reviews.title: What a view!
reviews.text: There are two main reasons for staying here: peaceful location and the spectacular view. If you do decide to stay here make sure to reserve a “superior” room (the ones up top with a view). Our view was absolutely breathtaking: the city of Varenna to the right, Bellagio across the lake and wide views of Lake Como and the hills surrounding. Boats would skim across the surface – very peaceful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a large balcony and instead of going to restaurants at night we bought food and wine at the local grocery store and ate while staring at the lake. The hotel is also a little distance away from the city of Varenna. Not too far, but far enough to make it more peaceful. The bed was a little soft for my taste, but the room was spacious and open, and the bathroom, although not luxurious, was definitely acceptable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Based primarily on recommendations from TripAdvisor, I selected Eremo Gaudio for it's uniqueness and, what I had read, incredible views of Lake Como. We were not disappointed. The hotel met all of our expectations and more.
reviews.title: Eremo Gaudio
Exceeded our expectations
reviews.text: Eremo Gaudio is a popular place so book your room early. We did so in July for October and the place was already booked. I kept emailing them and finally there was a cancellation. It was a suite - - the Teolinda Suite to be precise. It was a bit pricey for the area (who knows about Varenna except Rick Steve's readers) and double the price of a room in the lower level area of the hotel. It turned out our money was well spent. Situated between the lounge/restaurant level (located on the top floor) and the check in/cafe area on the lower level, our room was very private. There were no adjacent rooms on either side, though there were two rooms on the floor above us. We never heard any of our neighbors -- t.v., voices, footsteps, nothing. The suite has it's own private entrance from the outside. The suite itself was very large comprised of a sitting area, a large bed that was a bit soft but not uncomfortable, and a sufficiently-sized bathroom. Based on some of the reviews, I was expecting to find a monastic-type decor (i.e., sparse), but our room was decorated very nicely. It also was very clean. The balcony was amazing. Very expansive. Enjoyed several evenings drinking wine and watching the sunset. Overall, we really enjoyed Eremo Gaudio. It was a unique hotel experience. Additionally, Varenna turned out to be a really charming town. I was concerned that there would be nothing there, but they have some really good restaurants. In fact, one of our best meals of our entire trip was at Vecchia Varenna. Superb food and not outrageously expensive. Lakeside views are available at the restaurant. We did some hiking around the hotel and took the ferry to Bellagio. Better shopping there, but very touristy. Liked Varenna better particularly after all the hustle and bustle of Rome and Florence.

reviews.title: Amazing View!!!!!
reviews.text: One last comment. It really is a hike from the train station to Eremo Gaudio. With heavy bags it's a real workout if you're not in reasonably good shape or use to doing regular exercise. It takes about 30 minutes lugging heavy bags. You also have to walk along a busy thoroughfare that leads to the center of town. (The hotel is past this area.) It can be dangerous as cars travel pretty fast and there are some bends in the road. Then there's the road leading up to the hotel. It's a real killer with the luggage and bags. On the other hand, it's downhill going back to the train station. If you stay in one of the upper level rooms, you have to take the funicular/tram. Pretty cool!

The most spectacular view from a hotel that I have ever seen! We were in the lower section and had a room with a balcony that overlooked Lake Como. I've never seen anything like it before! The hotel is an old monastary half way up the side of a mountain. The best part is the tram ride up to the roof top restaurant, which aside from really good food, has the best dinner view you could posibly imagine. We plan on going back and using this location as a base to visit Switzerland, Austria, and Germany.
